message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to get a fantastic deal. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. Can you meet me at that price?
Thanks for your offer, Bob! I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $85. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it.
I'm still interested in the product, but I think $80 is a more reasonable price. Can you meet me at $82.50? I'm willing to compromise, but I don't want to go above that.
I understand your concerns, Bob, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can do $83 for the product. It's a great compromise, and I think you'll really enjoy it.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above $80. Can you meet me at $81.25? I think that's a fair price for the product.
I understand your persistence, Bob! I'm willing to make one more concession. I can do $82 for the product. It's getting close to the sweet spot, and I think you'll really love it.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still a bit above $80. Can you meet me at $80.50? I'm willing to make a final concession, but I need to stay within my budget.

I understand your final concession, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm going to make a counteroffer that's closer to my minimum. I can do $81 for the product. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy it.

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm afraid I've reached my limit. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet in the middle. I'll make one last offer: $80. I'm not willing to go any lower. If you can't meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $120.
